title: The Evolution of 20th Century Architecture - A Synoptic Account
description:
The Evolution of 20th Century Architecture - A Synoptic Account by Kenneth Frampton
English | November 30, 2007 | ISBN: 3211311955 | 159 pages | PDF | 6 MB

From Kenneth Frampton, the doyen of architectural history, comes The Evolution of 20th-Century Architecture: A Synoptic Account. In this radical new approach to the history of architecture, Frampton traces what he considers to be the most powerful four lines of architecture: the avant-garde (1887Ã¢â‚¬â€œ1986), organic architecture (1910Ã¢â‚¬â€œ1998), modern and national styles (1935Ã¢â‚¬â€œ1998), and industrialization and prefabrication (1927Ã¢â‚¬â€œ1990). Born from his confident eye for the history, theory, and motives behind architecture, this richly illustrated overview will certainly become an instant classic and required reading for a new generation of students and historians
